citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The licensee was unable to find the Program of Veterinary Care. Not being able to produce a Program of Veterinary Care
during inspection doesn't allow for APHIS officials to ensure the animals are being cared for as per the instructions of the
Attending Veterinarian. The licensee must find and produce the Program of Veterinary Care at the next inspection. If the
Program of Veterinary Care can't be found, then the licensee must have the Attending Veterinarian fill out a new Program
of Veterinary Care. Correct starting on 9/2/24.

On 3/23/24, a 10 year old Nubian goat (named "Hey Dammit") was euthanized. The day before the goat was kept outside
of its stall for approximately 1-2 hours while staff cleaned the inside of the enclosure. During this time, the goat did not
have access to any shelter. The temperature was approximately 32 degrees Fahrenheit and the facility representative
reported to me that there was a sleety rain during that time also. The goat was found to be laying in a corner of its
enclosure and was struggling. The facility representative reported to me that the goat was hypothermic. The goat was
treated per the attending veterinarians instructions and stabilized for a short while. However, the next day the goat started
seizuring and it was decided to euthanize the goat. I asked the facility representative if the goat had not been kept outside
for approximately 1-2 hours if she felt the goat would have had those veterinary care issues and ended up having to be
euthanized and she reported to me that it is unlikely that the goat would have had those issues and been euthanized had
it not been kept outside during that time.
Keeping animals outside in cold wet weather and not allowing them access to shelter can cause veterinary care issues
like what happened in this case. Animals must be provided shelter to protect them from the elements of the weather. If
animals are to be locked out of their stalls/shelter during the cleaning process, the cleaning process should be done as
expeditiously as possible to minimize any distress to the animals. They should be monitored closely to make sure they
aren't suffering any ill effects. During weather events, they can also be provided alternative shelter to prevent them from
not being able to access shelter at all times.
Correct starting on 8/19/24.

During inspection, a mouse was observed to be in the food storage container for the rabbits. Food storage that doesn't
properly keep out vermin allows for possible contamination of the food supplies. Food shall be stored in a manner that
adequately protects against infestation and contamination by vermin. Correct starting on 8/19/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The licensee was unable to find the Program of Veterinary Care. Not being able to produce a Program of Veterinary Care 
during inspection doesn't allow for APHIS officials to ensure the animals are being cared for as per the instructions of the 
Attending Veterinarian. The licensee must find and produce the Program of Veterinary Care at the next inspection. If the 
Program of Veterinary Care can't be found, then the licensee must have the Attending Veterinarian fill out a new Program 
of Veterinary Care. Correct starting on 9/2/24. 
2.131(b)(1)  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
On 3/23/24, a 10 year old Nubian goat (named "Hey Dammit") was euthanized. The day before the goat was kept outside 
of its stall for approximately 1-2 hours while staff cleaned the inside of the enclosure. During this time, the goat did not 
have access to any shelter. The temperature was approximately 32 degrees Fahrenheit and the facility representative 
reported to me that there was a sleety rain during that time also. The goat was found to be laying in a corner of its 
enclosure and was struggling. The facility representative reported to me that the goat was hypothermic. The goat was 
treated per the attending veterinarians instructions and stabilized for a short while. However, the next day the goat started 
seizuring and it was decided to euthanize the goat. I asked the facility representative if the goat had not been kept outside 
for approximately 1-2 hours if she felt the goat would have had those veterinary care issues and ended up having to be 
euthanized and she reported to me that it is unlikely that the goat would have had those issues and been euthanized had 
it not been kept outside during that time. 
 
Keeping animals outside in cold wet weather and not allowing them access to shelter can cause veterinary care issues 
like what happened in this case. Animals must be provided shelter to protect them from the elements of the weather. If 
animals are to be locked out of their stalls/shelter during the cleaning process, the cleaning process should be done as 
expeditiously as possible to minimize any distress to the animals. They should be monitored closely to make sure they 
aren't suffering any ill effects. During weather events, they can also be provided alternative shelter to prevent them from 
not being able to access shelter at all times. 
 
Correct starting on 8/19/24. 
3.50(c)

Facilities, general. 
During inspection, a mouse was observed to be in the food storage container for the rabbits. Food storage that doesn't 
properly keep out vermin allows for possible contamination of the food supplies. Food shall be stored in a manner that 
adequately protects against infestation and contamination by vermin. Correct starting on 8/19/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report. 
 
 n
